tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr Raviraj did the surgery in Apollo Hospital. The treatment in Apollo Hospital was very good and Dr Raviraj is a very friendly person, so the patient will feel much relaxed and confident. He said the exact time for the recovery which a patient should follow strictly and then he has recommended physiotherapy. I have done the follow up in his clinic which is located in Vijaya Bank Layout. That clinic is very good and clean. People are very helpful in the clinic. I highly recommend him for any orthopaedic problems.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I am seeing Dr. RaviRaj since past 3 years as he got his own clinic in Bannerghatta Road which is close to my residence. I had seen for ligament tear in the left foot, knee pain in my right polio leg and lower back pain related issues. As the Clinic is not disabled friendly (too many steps to climb) i always see him in Apollo Hospital, Bannerghatta Road...I just like the way he receives with a smile, listens to the whole concern and his observation towards the problem. He listens patiently and as per the issue he suggests whether X-Ray is required or not....I like his process of diagnosing the problem and gives correct medication or treatment. So far by God's grace i always had 100% recovery whenever i approach him with any problem in my leg or back....He guides me so well and motivates too that i should not take too much tension. I always come out of his consultation room with a smile!!! Thank you sooo much Dr. RaviRaj for your kind service and proper treatment.....I never had any issues as such. I strongly recommend him for any Orthopedic related problems!!! Kudos!!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Doctor Raviraj was referred by my General physican after seeing a mild damage in my MRI report of the spine. I was scared. When I visited his chamber, he carefully noted all my history of the back pain issue. Explained me the problem by looking at the MRI scans... Asked me not to worry but prescribed few medicines...Within few days only following his advice my pain got significantly better. He even responded to me quickly to help me finding a replacement medicine on chat. I am really glad to visit such a great doctor who listens to his patients and helps them to recover fast...I will visit again for further advice and definitely recommend others to consult him regarding any orthopedic issue..

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
He is our family doctor
 More than his profession he has been our very good family friend and welwisher. Excellent person with a lot of very very rare extraordinary qualities. very friendly, patient, considerative, very helping and what not. Extremely efficient professionally, guides perfectly, solves problems in the most appropriate and conservative manner. Never suggest any tests or medicines unnecessarily. You can be 100,% confident about his treatment and remain peaceful. Very very rare doctor in the present world. Extremely prompt in communication too inspire if his taxing schedule. Unbelievably so easily approachable any time.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,
review:
I have visited Dr Raviraj multiple times, for my parents,in-laws, spouse and for myself and i have the following observations:
1. Dr Raviraj is good and his diagnosis is fine and i would have recommended the doctor but for the below reason unable to do so.
2. Recently we met him for Gait movement disorder and after  consultation he directed to another doctor in Apollo. We met the Doctor in Apollo and it was detected a Early Parkinsons syndrome and he needed a x-ray just to check/clarify. We came to Vijaya Bank Medical just to get the x-ray done. Once done, the x-ray centre directed to Doctor to get the report. The receptionist said to get the report from doctor and consultation would not be charged and sent us in.  Once inside Dr. Raviraj again started the whole process he did few days back where he asked to meet the doctors of Apollo. Once we came out the receptionist asked for the consultation as we had spent sometime with doctor. 
3. The doctor always seems to be in a hurry and i felt it would be better if explains the issues a bit more, if any exercise needs to be done or how to better manage the problem. It seems the patient needs to asks more question to get information of the Doctor.
reply_text:
Hi arunav

Please note the following 

The fact that you have brought your many relatives and you have got treated urself with us indicates the trust that you had with us. We are concerned about the issue that you brought out . Please note the following 
The time spent in a particular consultation doesnot necessarily indicate the quality of treatment u get and the quality of the advice given.
Difficult situations and cases require longer time to assess and make a diagnosis. 
I take utmost care within the purview of my knowledge and experience to do best for my patients and also spend sufficient time as per the merit of individual cases. Some of the neurological conditions in elderly might overlap the orthopaedic conditions.this sometimes may require to see other specialists. 

Regarding the consultation fees charged we have a consultation charge of 350 INR and we donot charge any registration charges also. We have a policy of 4 days of free follow up consultation for every patients.  Subsequent visits are charged. This is required to run the place. 
These charges are nominal for a orthopaedic consultation.
Should u have any further issues please contact us.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr.Raviraj.A is a definitely the best Orthopedist in Bangalore.He did the accurate diagnosis for my back pain and I got better post treatment from him.It was a wonder! I had the toughest time of my life for 7 long years with back pain visiting many orthopedics,physical therapists,MRIs,screenings l,X-rays what not? I happened to read an article written by him in a newspaper and was surprised to see his clinic close to my house. This feedback is with respect to the treatment given to me in 2013. Loads of thanks to Dr.Raviraj from my entire family!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: My 5 year old daughters arm bone has got twisted/dislocated while playing. He fixed it in a jiffy! Dr Raviraj is a very skilled and hands_on doctor as far his approach to this problem went. He gave my kid the confidence to let him check her and clicked her bone back to its place in a second! He explained the issue and warned us to be careful for a week l, gave us back up medications for pain just in case, which we didn't have to use. Overall, as parents in despair, he was extremely sensitive *** ********* ** *** ********** Would recommend him any day!!!

tags: None
review: *** ***** **** ************* *** patiently listened to the issues described.  Grateful that he rightly identified deficiencies and explored other options before suggesting MRI. Only wish the doctor had some time to pause and reflect on the patient's symptoms - I'm sure with his experience this will throw up possibilities that even multiple tests may not, especially when the case doesn't follow a straight forward route. I guess the fact that there are so many patients waiting does not leave enough time for this currently.  But for a patient banking on the doctor's experience, this would make a huge difference. Just my humble opinion,  respectfully.

Happy with: Doctor friendliness, Explanation of the health issue, Treatment satisfaction
Great Experience and very much comfortable doctor
The doctor is friendly and takes his time listen to patients. I value his professional opinion and feel at ease after visiting the clinic. My doctor always has time to talk about issues in depth and is open to looking at new ways of dealing with them. I cant speak highly enough of the support that my doctor has given me.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I had visited Dr Raviraj a year back. listens to your problem patiently.. advises well and soft spoken. Recently when I sprain my back he was first on my mind.  He was out of Bangalore but he advised medicine over phone for immediate relief and assured incase of emergency, his team at Apollo will help out. would surely recommend. Thank you Dr Raviraj

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I have been suffering with lower back pain from a very long time like around 1.5 yrs. I consulted with several doctors in apollo, fortis etc. They always recomended me physiotherapy which did not help.

To be clear on whats the issue Dr Raviraj asked me to do MRI as xray and blood tests were already done amd we dis not find any problem.

He gave me the medication after looking at the MRI which has helped me a lot. I hope this pain will go away for good soon. 

Thank you Dr. Raviraj and Practo for showing me the way.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I had undergone ACL reconstruction surgery at Appolo Bannerghatta by Dr. Raviraj .
After almost a year I still have a pain in my knee . When I complained him about pain he gave me pills *** *** *** ******** **** ******** ** **** and told every thing seems ok .
When  I visited other doctors they are saying it seems there is definitely some issue due to my leg movement they observed  .And I have recovered only 80 %  only .Seriously they promise you will recover 100% blah blah but once your surgery done they don't even bother for you .

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: With the recommendation from my friend I visited doctor Raviraj for my leg as I met with an accident I had severe swelling in the mid foot and wound in the ankle part (which was from crape bandage) ****** *** *** ******** *** ***** ******** ** *** ******* ****** *** treated only the wound inspite of me trying to explain him the situation which was leading to change in the shape of leg and doctor told me that i have flat foot and cannot be changed which then made me go for a second opinion as is now been diagnosed as lisfranc injury which require surgery. ** **** *** ********* ** *** ***** ***** ******** **** *** ** ********

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Doctor friendliness,
review: Doc is very good and there is no any doubt..i was not happy with only one thing which I am explaining below..  For my problem, doc advised for MRI.  I went to jayanagar and spend 4 hours to get the MRI done and came to vijaya medical centre clinic to show the reports , the girl at the reception told me to wait as there are 9 patients and mentioned most of them wanted to show the reports.. which was not correct...most of the patients came for reconsultation...I requested her after waiting for 1 hour that I just need to show the reports but she was little rude..and asked me if it was emergency...and asked me to wait...i.did not expect this. While writing this feedback, i am still waiting and not sure when my number will come to show the reports...not so professional behaviour towards existing patients who came to show just the reports..

review: Doctor was very friendly and professional. Only portion of improvement required is in queue management.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,

tags: Value for money,Wait time,
review: Unnecessarily talkative and time consuming which lead to 3 hours of wait for an issue which came to be normal, X ray price is way too much
reply_text:
I think you have got something totally wrong here. If you have visited for Physio therapy for rehabilitation u should have met a physiotherapist and not a orthopaedic surgeon. 
It‚Äôs not right on your part to comment that doctor I was talkative .. please clarify who was talkative yourself , receptionist or the doctor ?? 
I think that‚Äôs your perception issue and this is not the right platform to comment on any one personally. Regarding the waiting I guess you are exaggerating it as total duration of the appointment system itself does not extend to the extent of time you have mentioned. The doctor always obliged and sees the patients in severe pain and children , elderly or those with fracture are emergency. You are taking an appointment with a specialist who caters to so many other patients also and wen u have an emergency to your own near and dear one would understand the delay in the appointments.
That requires a bit of patience and understanding the medical  treatment. There are quite a few walk-in patients coming whom we do not refuse treatment. 

There are also practo patients who are reporting beyond the scheduled appointment and still claim that they have an appointment and fight with receptionist and we still try to accommodate them as walk in and not refuse to see them . Wetry to maintain the schedule as far as possible . This is our humble request to co operate with the consultation. 
It‚Äôs not a platform to discuss who is talkative who was fussy and who is dumb.
People come in all shapes sizes and colours and behavioural habits and no one is to judge any one. 
Regarding the test which came as normal. Please understand that the test is done to identify a possible problem. And test is negative is not something to be unhappy about. You should be happy if a test comes negative. In that case if we could know which test would come as positive or surely show a problem, we could only order such tests. But then it won‚Äôt be called as a test !!

Regarding the comment about x ray cost I don‚Äôt think this is a good platform to discuss this I think practo also should make a note of these feedback‚Äôs were patient comments personally about the doctor / cost etc 
U need to understand the market cost of a digital x rays and we are at par with the present market rates. 

If you are talking about the doctor being talkative , he needs to be talking to patients that‚Äôs an integral part of consultation. There are people who think doctor did not speak to them at length and then there are some who say he talks too much. After all we are all humans and we too have talkative / less talking patients which we never complain about. This profession involves dealing with people and they come in variety. So are the doctors.
